ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] One hour to vote!
ygData.msgSnippet: Guild not giving you enough attention? ... From: Kent King  To:  Sent: Tuesday, December 30, 2003 5:52
ygData.messageBody:
Guild not giving you enough attention?

----- Original Message -----
From: "Kent King" <propellerheadus@...>
To: <EverQuest@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, December 30, 2003 5:52 PM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] One hour to vote!


> If you guys think I suck, then say "yes you suck". If
> you'd like for me to stay in this community then reply
> "no please don't go".
>
> I've played everquest since 4/1/99, and I know a
> little about playing monks since I've had one as my
> main the whole time.
>
> Up to you.
>
> Hello,
>
> We have received a request from you to unsubscribe
> from the
> EverQuest group. Please confirm your request by
> replying to this message. If you do not wish to
> unsubscribe from
> EverQuest, please ignore this message.
>
> Regards,
>
> Yahoo! Groups Customer Care
>
> Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to
> http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
>
>
>
> --- Lorie C <mlchiello@...> wrote:
> > Bards have limitations??? OMG!! No-one told me :)
> > Actually, I am a fairly mellow bard. I don't solo at
> > all /grin
> >
> > Monks and bards are awesome together as a pull team.
> > That is how we do the Rathe Council :)
> >
> > Awulfie A'Mused
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: Gibson, Sara Michele
> > To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> > Sent: Tuesday, December 30, 2003 1:19 PM
> > Subject: RE: [EverQuest] Everquest interview...
> >
> >
> > Personally, I love monks, and love to have a well
> > played one in my group. Some of my closest friends
> > are monks, and they play their role very well and
> > are an asset to any group they are in. Including
> > their ability to pull and melee. Some of the things
> > in the last patch were designed to make them a more
> > powerful class. However, I do seem to have had some
> > problems with bards. Only met a couple that could
> > play their class and be a benefit to the group they
> > were in. If you don't think that you can be a
> > benefit as a certain class, then maybe you should
> > look into creating a different character. But
> > remember, all classes have their limitations, and it
> > is how you handle those limitations that makes the
> > character an asset.
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> --------------------------------------------------------------------------
----
> >
> > From: Kent King [mailto:propellerheadus@...]
> >
> > Sent: Tuesday, December 30, 2003 1:13 PM
> > To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> > Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Everquest interview...
> >
> >
> >
> > Ummmmmm, ok if you say so. I'm still paying my
> > subscription so I am "dealing with it" obviously.
> > My
> > problem is not a small one. Bards have a role,
> > monks
> > do not. We can't tank. We can't harmony. We
> > can't
> > do melee damage like a Rogue or a Warrior. We are
> > too
> > stupid for trade skills (although that's what I
> > spend
> > most of my game time doing since groups only pick
> > up
> > monks as one of the "extra one or two".
> >
> > The idea of a monk class does rock, I agree, but
> > since
> > they took pulling away from us, and they took
> > tanking
> > away from us, all we can do is lay down and play
> > dead
> > and hope for a charitable group to pick us up once
> > in
> > a while.
> >
> > That's a thing.
> >
> > Quwi
> > --- Lorie C <mlchiello@...> wrote:
> > > You cannot whine about monks being nerfed. Bards
> > > have been nerfed on almost every patch. Roll
> > with it
> > > and deal. Monks still rock.
> > >
> > > I would like to hear from the part of the dev
> > team
> > > that deals with the classes, and how the deal
> > with
> > > what they envision for the classes.
> > >
> > > And please, who coined the phrase, "Working as
> > > intended." That kills me!
> > >
> > > Awulfie A'Mused
> > > ----- Original Message -----
> > > From: Kent King
> > > To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> > > Sent: Monday, December 29, 2003 7:54 PM
> > > Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Everquest
> > interview...
> > >
> > >
> > > LOL, not sure the name, but I'd love to hear
> > from
> > > who
> > > the frock made the decision to nerf the monk
> > class
> > > out
> > > of general usefulness. Brad? I have a
> > message
> > > for
> > > him not suitable for minors who might read
> > this
> > > board,
> > > but you can picture what it might be after all
> > of
> > > the
> > > time I have invested in my monk. </em grins
> > > evilly>
> > >
> > > Quwi Changkane Grandmaster of Fenin Ro
> > >
> > > --- goldleader <swany0916@...> wrote:
> > > > I'm planning an interview with a developer
> > or
> > > > producer for
> > > > Everquest. Who do you guys think would make
> > an
> > > > interesting interview?
> > > >
> > > > Any questions you'd like answered?
> > > >
> > > > Thanks,
> > > >
> > > > David
> > > > VideoGameRadio.com
> > > >
> > > >
> > >
